experience.title: Co-Founder
experience.description: India is a vast country with a huge reliance on 2-wheelers. Yet, it is tragic to see how 2-wheelers often become a bane to their riders. Wouldnâ€™t it be great if we could provide 2-wheelers with the important comforts of car like safety, comfort and protection? Sepal does exactly this! It is a revolutionary bike accessory designed by a group of IIT engineers to give riders complete control over their journey. Sepal is a collapsible roof that can be quickly attached to any motorcycle and it shall provide the riders with complete protection from Sun, rain dust and even cold, entirely on-demand. Also, it is integrated with electronics, handle buttons and a mobile app to provide the riders with all IOT comforts present in a car such as navigation, call alerts, music at their fingertips!!

experience.title: Research Assistant
experience.description: Determined its performance level when subjected to different earthquake magnitudes. Evaluated the safety margin that IS guidelines imparted to the structure to sustain earthquakes. Studied the plastic hinge formation pattern and the failure mechanism of the building

experience.title: Research Fellow
experience.description: Assisted in the construction of a half-scale 2 story 2 frame reinforced concrete structureSimulated seismic conditions by displacing the structure back and forth in cycles using hydraulicactuator until it reached 50% strength reductionSuggested changes to improve the performance by 34% with just 2% increase in costs Programmed a UniaxialMaterial called smoothFlagePole in Opensees, which models the materialproperties of flagpole type material with corners smoothened using Bezier curves

experience.title: Research Fellow
experience.description: Devised a numerical method to determine settlement and stress fields in shallow foundations on rock masses using the 2nd order compatibility and equilibrium equations at the interfaceUtilized Hoek-Brown failure criteria to establish the bearing capacity required for rock masses and studied its variation with change in ratio of elasticity of footing to that of rock massAdvantages of this method include very less computational time, high accuracy, applicability to flexible footings, identification of critical point and applicability to complex loading problems
experience.description_html: Devised a numerical method to determine settlement and stress fields in shallow foundations on rock masses using the 2nd order compatibility and equilibrium equations at the interfaceUtilized Hoek-Brown failure criteria to establish the bearing capacity required for rock masses and studied its variation with change in ratio of elasticity of footing to that of rock massAdvantages of this method include very less computational time, high accuracy, applicability to flexible footings, identification of critical point and applicability to complex loading problems
